items.text: short outside off. Looks to pull it wide of mid-on, can't get past Henry's dive
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: length on off stump, flicked to deep midwicket
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

items.text: short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
items.postText: Mike: "Soumya Sarkar's record is ok, couple of hundreds and average of 35 is perfectly fine. How Sabbir keeps getting games is beyond me though. What happened to Mossadek Hossain?" --- Well, Sabbir's had a disciplinary ban end prematurely to play him in this series, so they clearly rate him highly...
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: short of a length and slanted down leg side
items.postText: Saleque Sufi: "On this ground Bangladesh needs 275 plus to compete . The way it shaped up so far Bangladesh will be lucky if they can reach 200 . That wont be enough "
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, 1 wide

items.text: length outside off, leans in and runs it straight to backward point
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: full and in at off stump. Jabbed to mid-off with static feet
items.postText: Rex: "I agree with SeanTheMexican and would add that Richard Hadlee and Shane Warne are also examples of players the selectors stuck with early in their careers."
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: short ball, 152.4kph, in the corridor. Looks to dab it down to third man but Lockie's been bowling wide of the crease all day. The room for that shot is decreasing at every point after delivery. This one is jammed into the turf past off stump
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: short of a length, slanting in outside off again. Beaten on the edge as he looks to run this down as well
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: short and up at the hips. Hurriedly clips this past backward square leg
items.postText: Azmal Tanjim: "Most of the people of Bangladesh are very disappointed with the overall performance of Soumya and Liton as all of us expect high from them. Soumya mainly depends on his hand-eye co-ordination rather than depending on his footwork. I think he has some problems with shot selection and judgment. But it is eye-pleasing when they are on the rhythm." --- Yup. Liton is class when he gets in. Which happens far too little.
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: short at leg stump, gets inside the line and swishes uppishly to fine leg
items.postText: Ryan: "@Ahmad, Adam Milne is just about to return from injury for his domestic side" --- Just did a couple of days ago. Bowling change - here is Santner.
items.shortText: Ferguson to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

items.text: full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
items.shortText: Santner to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: beaten in flight but he's down the track and drives this in the gap. That dipped on him outside off and he was driving after it had turned away. Single at sweeper
items.shortText: Santner to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

items.text: short and just outside off. Cut to sweeper's left
items.shortText: Santner to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: stumping appeal down leg side as Sabbir slips attempting a sweep. Lost his footing...and he is short as he looks to get the back bat in. That's unfortunate. It's a length ball down leg. His front heel slips on the surface as he chases this. He's in a tangle with both feet out of the crease and his body on the floor. Panic as he looks to sweep the bat along the ground and into the crease. Latham's taken some time with that stumping, but there's enough going against Sabbir for him to be marginally short
items.shortText: Santner to Sabbir Rahman, 1 wide, OUT

dismissal.text: Sabbir Rahman st †Latham b Santner 13 (23m 20b 2x4 0x6) SR: 65.00

items.text: full on off stump, driven to extra cover
items.shortText: Santner to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: lifts it over mid-on. Safe, in theory. Length ball at off stump. Steps out and hits it on the up, against the turn
items.shortText: Santner to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, FOUR runs

items.text: shot. Full and just outside off. Leans in nicely on the front foot and caresses this between cover and short extra. Gorgeous
items.postText: Imam: "There is nothing wrong with Sabbir and Soumya. Even players like Tamim and Mushfiq took a long time to settle. The problem is in our substandard domestic cricket which is no preparation for international cricket. "
items.shortText: Santner to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, FOUR runs

items.text: short of a length on off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: short at off stump, looks to steal a single after dropping this pitch side with soft hands. Cover fielder too quick
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: short and down leg side, left alone
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, 1 wide

items.text: length and in at off stump. Opens the face and runs it down to third man
items.postText: Leigh Hawkins: "@Iman - NZ has struggled with the same issue, they now identify the cricketers they think can cope with international cricket and get them in their systems as soon as possible and use the 20/20 matches to give them experience"
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: length on off stump, defended into the covers
items.postText: Michael : "Clinical performance by the bowlers and good fielding. Proud to be an overseas Blackcaps supporter following from my laptop. We seem to have discovered a new level of depth. It is no longer a huge worry if someone is injured or unavailable"
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.preText: Md. Muhaimin Ra: "Tamim didn't take long time to settle..he just thrashed India in 2007 world cup and showed what he is"
items.text: short and in the corridor. Defended to point's left with soft hands
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run

items.text: oh geez. It's not quite a Lockie spell without one of these. Wide of the crease and, eventually, wide of the keeper. This pitches outside leg and sails down to the fine leg boundary.
items.postText: That indiscretion from Lockie has brought to my attention the leg gully fielder who had been brought in. Previously at backward square leg.
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, 5 wides

items.text: length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
items.postText: Srk: "NZ needs to slot in Ish Sodhi in yheir odi lineup, u dont need 3-allrounders, but you definitely need match winner(wrist spinners are gold in LOI's)"
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, no run
